contentrichtext.text: {{original research|date=March 2012}} {{Infobox Software | name = VirtualDubMod | logo = | screenshot = [[File:VirtualDubMod in Wine.png|300px]] | caption = | developer = | programming language = C, C++, Pascal | latest_release_version = 1.5.10.2 | latest_release_date = {{Start date and age|2005|08|29}} | latest preview version = | latest preview date = | operating_system = [[Microsoft Windows]] | genre = [[video capture]], [[video processing]] | status = [[Abandonware]] | license = [[GNU General Public License|GNU GPL]] | website = {{URL|virtualdubmod.sourceforge.net}} }} '''VirtualDubMod''' was an [[open source]] [[video capture]] and [[video processing|processing]] tool for [[Microsoft Windows]], based on Avery Lee's [[VirtualDub]]. ==History== Version 1.5.10.2 (build 2542) was released on 21 February 2006. VirtualDub's author, which hosts VirtualDubMod's forums, claimed that development had been [[Abandonware|abandoned]].<ref>{{cite web| url=http://forums.virtualdub.org/index.php?act=ST&f=12&t=8931| title=Status Of VirtualDubMod, and forum change| author=[[VirtualDub]]'s author| publisher=forums.virtualdub.org| date=2005-02-03| accessdate=2009-06-16}}</ref> A version labeled as "VirtualDubMod 1.6.0.0 SURROUND", dated 9 April 2006, was released by a company called Aud-X.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.aud-x.com| title=Aud-X| publisher=aud-x.com| date=2006-03-16| accessdate=2009-06-16}}</ref> A Version 1.5.10.3 build 2550 was released by VirtualDub-Fr.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.virtualdub-fr.org| title=VirtualDub-Fr| publisher=VirtualDub-Fr.org| date=2010-01-29| accessdate=2010-01-29}}</ref> ==Features== VirtualDubMod merged several specialized [[Fork (software development)|forks]] of VirtualDub posted on the [[Doom9]] forums. Added features included [[Matroska]] (MKV) support, [[OGM]] support, and [[MPEG-2]] support.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://sourceforge.net/mailarchive/message.php?msg_id=350319 | title=Matroska open source A/V container format officially released | publisher=sourceforge.net | author=Christian HJ Wiesner | date=2003-04-30 |accessdate=2011-06-27}}</ref> One notable feature that remains missing in VirtualDubMod is the ability to program timed video captures, which was present in one VirtualDub fork called VirtualDubVCR.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.virtualdub.net/download.htm| title=Download| publisher=virtualdub.net| language=[[German language|German]]| accessdate=2009-06-16}}</ref> Despite the abandonment of development of VirtualDubMod, some of its features can be added to VirtualDub through input plugins and [[Windows legacy audio components#Audio Compression Manager|ACM]] [[codec]]s provided by users on VirtualDub forums.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://forums.virtualdub.org/index.php?act=SF&f=7 | title=VirtualDub Filters and Filter Development | publisher=Unofficial VirtualDub Support Forums | accessdate=2012-02-01}}</ref> ==See also== * [[Avidemux]] - a cross platform program similar to VirtualDub, available for Linux, Windows and Mac. * [[Comparison of video editing software]] * [[VirtualDub]] * [[Doom9]] ==References== <references/> ==External links== *{{ Official site |http://virtualdubmod.sourceforge.net }} *[http://sourceforge.net/projects/virtualdubmod SourceForge Project Page] *{{cite web| url=http://forums.virtualdub.org/?c=5| title=Forums| publisher=forums.virtualdub.org| accessdate=2009-06-16}} *{{cite web| url=http://www.videohelp.com/tools/VirtualdubMOD| title=Help page| publisher=videohelp.com | accessdate=2009-06-16}} {{Video editors}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Virtualdubmod}} [[Category:Free video software]] [[Category:Free software programmed in C]] [[Category:Free software programmed in C++]] [[Category:Free software programmed in Pascal]] [[Category:Windows-only free software]]
